sen.j: 穂積百足（ほづみのももたり、生年不詳 - 天武天皇元年（672年）6月29日）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: HOZUMI no Momotari (year of birth unknown - June 29, 672, is Japanese of Asuka period.
HOZUMI no Momotari (year of birth unknown-June 29, 672) is Japanese of Asuka period.
HOZUMI no Momotari (year of birth unknown-June 29, 672) is Japanese of Asuka period.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「ほづみのももたり」で同じ。
sen.e: The reading of the name in old Japanese syllabary is the same with 'HOZUMI no Momotari.'
The reading of the name in old Japanese syllabary is the same with 'HOZUMI no Momotari.'

sen.j: 姓（カバネ）は臣。
sen.e: Kabane (hereditary title) is Omi.
His kabane (hereditary title) is Omi.
sen.cmt: Kabaneはhis kabaneと修正しました。
sen.e: His kabane (hereditary title) is Omi.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で、大友皇子（弘文天皇）のために倭京で兵を集めているとき、敵兵に殺された。
sen.e: In Jinshin War of 672, he was killed by an enemy soldier when he had been gathering soldiers in the City in Yamato for Prince Otomo (Emperor Kobun).
In Jinshin War of 672, he was killed by an enemy soldier when he was gathering soldiers in the City in Yamato for Prince Otomo (later Emperor Kobun).
sen.cmt: had been gatheringの時制を修正しました。天皇名の前にlaterを補足しました。
sen.e: In Jinshin War of 672, he was killed by an enemy soldier when he was gathering soldiers in the City in Yamato for Prince Otomo (later Emperor Kobun).

sen.j: 壬申の年の6月に大海人皇子（天武天皇）が挙兵したことを知った近江宮の朝廷は、各地に使者を派遣して鎮圧のための軍を興させた。
sen.e: In June of the year of Mizunoe-Saru (one of the Oriental Zodiac), the Imperial Court of Omi no miya which knew Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) raised an army dispatched the envoys to many places and raised an army for its suppression.
In June of the same year, the Imperial Court of Omi no miya which knew Prince Oama (later Emperor Tenmu) raised an army dispatched the envoys to many places and raised an army for its suppression.
sen.cmt: 「壬申の年」を訳す必要はないと思われます。天皇名の前にlaterを補足しました。
sen.e: In June of the same year, the Imperial Court of Omi no miya which knew Prince Oama (later Emperor Tenmu) raised an army dispatched the envoys to many places and raised an army for its suppression.

sen.j: このとき倭京への使者にたったのが、穂積百足とその弟穂積五百枝、物部日向であった。
sen.e: The envoys to the City in Yamato were HOZUMI no Momotari and his younger brothers, HOZUMI no Ioe and MONONOBE no Himuka on this occasion.
The envoys to the City in Yamato were HOZUMI no Momotari and his younger brothers, HOZUMI no Ioe and MONONOBE no Himuka on this occasion.
The envoys to the City in Yamato were HOZUMI no Momotari and his younger brothers, HOZUMI no Ioe and MONONOBE no Himuka on this occasion.

sen.j: ここでいう倭（やまと）は大和国のことで、倭京とは飛鳥にあった古い都をいう。
sen.e: In this case, Yamato means Yamato Province and the City in Yamato means the former capital in Asuka.

sen.j: そこには留守司として高坂王がおり、ともに軍の編成に携わった。
sen.e: There was Prince Takasaka as Rusutsukasa (a guard of the City) and he engaged in the organization of the army together.
There was Prince Takasaka as Rusutsukasa (a guard of the City) and he engaged in the organization of the army together.

sen.j: その陣営は飛鳥寺の西の槻の下にあった。
sen.e: The camp was under a zelkova tree in the west of Asuka-dera Temple.
The camp was under a zelkova tree in the west of Asuka-dera Temple.

sen.j: しかしこのとき、倭では大伴吹負が大海人皇子のために数十人の同志を得て戦う準備を進めていた。
sen.e: But then, OTOMO no Fukei got the dozens of comrades and forwarded the preparation of the war for Prince Oama in Yamato.
But then, OTOMO no Fukei got the dozens of comrades and forwarded the preparation of the war for Prince Oama in Yamato.

sen.j: 吹負は別の留守司である坂上熊毛と相談して、吹負が外から高市皇子を名乗って近づき、熊毛が内応するという計画を立てた。
sen.e: Fukei talked with another Rusutsukasa, SAKANOUE no Kumake, to make a plan that Fukei would approach from outside under the false name of Prince Takechi, and then Kumake would betray a secret.
Fukei talked with another Rusutsukasa, SAKANOUE no Kumake, to make a plan that Fukei would approach from outside under the false name of Prince Takechi, and then Kumake would betray a secret.

sen.j: 高市皇子はその頃美濃国にあって大海人皇子のために軍を編成していた。
sen.e: Prince Takechi was organizing the army for Prince Oama in Mino Province at that time.
Prince Takechi was organizing the army for Prince Oama in Mino Province at that time.

sen.j: それが早くも倭に現れたと虚報を流そうというのである。
sen.e: Despite that, the false information that he already appeared in Yamato was about to be spread.
Despite that, Fukei tried to let the false information spread that Prince Takechi had already appeared in Yamato.
sen.cmt: 虚報を流そうとしたのは吹負だと解釈されるので修正しました。
sen.e: Despite that, Fukei tried to let the false information spread that Prince Takechi had already appeared in Yamato.

sen.j: 6月29日、吹負らは飛鳥寺の西の槻の下の陣営に入り、内応を得て軍の指揮権を乗っ取った。
sen.e: On June 29, Fukei and the others went into the camp under the zelkova tree in the west of Asuka-dera Temple and took over the command of the army after getting a betrayal.

sen.e: On June 29, Fukei and the others went into the camp under the zelkova tree in the west of Asuka-dera Temple and took over the command of the army after having got a betrayal.

sen.j: そのとき穂積百足は小墾田の兵庫（武器庫）にあって、武器を近江国に運ばせていた。
sen.e: HOZUMI no Momotari was letting them move weapons to Omi Province at Hyogo (a shed of weapon) in a small newly cultivated land at that time.
HOZUMI no Momotari was letting his soldiers move weapons to Omi Province at Hyogo (a shed of weapon) in a small newly cultivated land at that time.
sen.cmt: themを理解しやすいようにhis soldiersと修正しました。
sen.e: HOZUMI no Momotari was letting his soldiers move weapons to Omi Province at Hyogo (a shed of weapon) in a small newly cultivated land at that time.

sen.j: 吹負は高市皇子の命だと言って百足を呼び寄せた。
sen.e: Fukei lied to Momotari about the order from Prince Takechi to summon.
Fukei lied to Momotari that it was the order from Prince Takechi that Momotari was summoned.
sen.cmt: 英文を原文の意味に沿って修正しました。

sen.j: 百足は馬に乗ってゆっくり近づき、飛鳥寺の西の槻の下に来た。
sen.e: Momotari riding a horse approached slowly and came under a zelkova tree in the west of Asuka-dera Temple.

sen.j: ある人に「馬から下りよ」と言われたが、下りる動作も遅かった。
sen.e: He was said 'Get off the horse' by someone but his movement of getting off was also slow.

sen.j: 襟をつかまれて引きずりおろされ、一本の矢を射当てられ、刀で斬り殺された。
sen.e: Dragged down with his collar grabbed, he was shot by an arrow and killed with a sword.

sen.j: かくして倭京の軍は大海人皇子の側に寝返った。
sen.e: Thus the army of the City in Yamato went over to the Prince Oama side.
